body.p: In connection with the beginning of the new academic year in our colony schools, it is well to point out which of our school books are more suitable, for instruction. There are several works, which my opinion are the best for our schools, by the existing . They are: 1) The Alphabet, by F. F. , this book is well and very popular. The new edition of it, was published by the American Publishing , with the new orthography, new clear illustrations and on good paper. Stories" for children by State Publishing. In addition to the above mentioned Copybook" by P. A. and the "Atlas" . the first book you can easily teach the children the calligraphy. In the second book, there are pictures of our city and country life, which give the children an understanding of the old country. As a second book after The Alphabet, it is well to recommend the book Living Word by A. Ya Ostrogorsky, corrected with the new orthography and with added original pictures. Also, it has beautiful fragments of classical literature and copies of famous paintings of famous Russian artists such as and others.

It is much more complicated as to grammar. On the new Russian orthography, there is not a single grammar in United States. There are Russian Publications on the market, but for American born children, they are difficult and not easily understood. Many colonists through misunderstanding are calling the new orthography "bolshevistic", but this is not so. The new Russian orthographic was worked out by the Imperial, Russian Academy of Science shortly before the Revolution, partly affirmed by the temporary government and finally carried out by the Bolshevics. The Bolshevics accomplished the things in which their predecessors failed.
